* Represents the types of commands supported by the application.
* Each constant corresponds to a specific user command that can be
EXIT, LIST, MARK, UNMARK, DELETE, TODO, DEADLINE, EVENT, FIND
* The main entry point for the Nova application.
* It works with {@link Ui}, {@link Parser}, {@link TaskList},
* and {@link Storage}, loads existing tasks on startup and runs a command loop
* Initializes the user interface and storage components, and attempts
* to load existing tasks from the specified file path. If loading fails
* due to an I/O error, an error message is displayed and the application
* starts with an empty task list.
* @param filePath The file path used for loading and saving tasks.
* Runs the main command loop of the application.
* Displays a welcome message, then repeatedly reads user input,
* parses it into a {@link Command}, and executes it until an exit
* Any {@link NovaException} thrown during parsing or execution is
* caught and shown to the user as an error message. Any {@link IOException}
* related to loading or saving tasks is also caught and reported.

* Parses user input into {@link Command} objects.
* This class contains utility methods for validating and interpreting
* raw command strings entered by the user.
* Parses the user input string into a {@link Command}.
* @param input The raw command entered by the user.
* @return A {@code Command} representing the parsed user input.
* @throws NovaException If the input is invalid, missing required parts, or the command is unrecognised.

* Handles user interaction via the command line.
* {@code Ui} is responsible for reading user input and displaying messages
* such as prompts, errors, and task-related feedback.
private final Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);
* Displays the welcome message when the application starts.
* Prints a greeting, a short prompt, and a separator line to the console.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
* Reads a command from standard input.
* Displays an error message to the user.
* Prints the given message prefixed with an error indicator and
* @param message The error message to be displayed.
showError("I couldn't load your tasks file.");
* Displays the farewell message when the application exits.
* Prints a goodbye message surrounded by separator lines.
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Displays the header for the task list.
* Prints a separator line followed by a message indicating
* that the list of tasks will be shown.
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Displays a single task item in the task list.

* Displays a confirmation message that a task has been marked as not done.
* @param taskString The string representation of the unmarked task.

* Displays a confirmation message that a task has been deleted.
* @param removedTaskString The string representation of the deleted task.
* @param remaining The number of tasks remaining in the list.
public void showTaskDeleted(String removedTaskString, int remaining) {

* Displays a confirmation message that a task has been added.
